main event: A bright circular object was observed flying in a Northwest to Southeast direction at a speed of 50-55 mph on 22 April 1963.
interesting points: The object exhibited an erratic and jumpy flight., No smoke or exhaust was observed from the object., The sighting lasted for 11 minutes., There were high altitude jet aircraft performing test runs in the vicinity at the time of the sighting., The sighted object may have been mistaken for a high altitude balloon or satellite.
witness description: a non-military resident of Port Allen, Kauai, Hawaii
